title: Favorite Local Yarn Shops
name: Favorite Local Yarn Shops
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

Please add your best knitting shops and spots for knittng to this map.

****

knitting, crochet, knit, yarn, crafts, crafty, hanging out

properties.name: Abundant Yarn
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 8524 SE 17th Avenue, Portland, OR 97202Store & Café Hours Mon 10am-7pm Tue, Wed, Thu 10am-9pm Fri, Sat 10am-6pm Sun 12pm-5pm A Portland yarn shop like no other. We are a spacious, friendly, full-service yarn store with two lovely classrooms, experienced staff, a cafe, a wide range of workshops and a gorgeous selection of yarns. We are located in the Sellwood neighborhood of Portland, Oregon just a few blocks south of Tacoma on SE 17th Avenue. We are handicapped-accessible and right on the #70 bus line with our own parking lot for cars and bikes.

properties.name: Asheville NC Home Crafts
properties.description: Posted by Js11281 Page Avenue, Asheville NC 28801Asheville NC Home Crafts is one of my favorite yarn stores (and I\'ve been to many!). They feature almost exclusively fibers, roving, glorious handspun yarns, and knitted items from local sheep/ llama/ alpaca/ angora rabbit/ angora goat/ etc farms, spinners, knitters, artisans, etc. I bought a hank of beautiful, soft, naturally variegated, handspun angora yarn from here, which I ultimately knitted into a luxurious little under scarf. I would travel to Asheville from the DC area just to visit this store again.

properties.name: Classic Yarns of Grafton
properties.description: Posted by Justagirlinma 202 Worcester Street, North Grafton, MA 01536Classic Yarns of Grafton is a friendly, customer oriented, one stop shopping experience. Carries a wide array of notions, buttons and needles, of which Addi Turbo and bamboo are the most popular. Some of the current lines are Debbie Bliss, Rowan, Jaeger, Tahki-Stacey Charles, Noro, Brown Sheep, Mountain Colors and Ironstone. The walls are filled floor to ceiling with fabulous yarns. Also offers knitting/crochet classes, as well as various workshops.

properties.name: Cozy
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 770 9th St, Durham, 27705This is the first place I ever went to for knitting supplies. I was working at Elmo\'s Diner up the street and a friend of mine there was a serious knitter. She taught a lot of us how to knit and eventually started working part time at Cozy. Heather, if you see this, you are a natural teacher! Thanks for giving us all the gift of craft! The shop is small, but they have everything you need. They are also very friendly and helpful and not at all snooty. Bring in your knitting conundrums and they\'ll help you out.

properties.name: Creative Warehouse
properties.description: Posted by Mrsmat04220 Reservoir St. Needham Heights, MA 02494Address: 220 Resevoir Street Riverbend Office Park Needham Heights, MA 02494 Phone: 781 444 9341 Fax: 781 449 6322 E-mail: Creativewarehse@cs.com Winter Hours: Mon. - Sat. 10 - 4:30 Sun 12 - 4:00 Always Closed on Wednesday Great shop. It is packed full of yarn. It can be overwhelming the first time in. They have bins of sale yarns that is a bit of work to look through but has great bargains. They are going to be expanding in 2007/2008.

properties.name: I Knit
properties.description: Posted by Keltiwoman13 Bonnington Square, London, EnglandI confess I haven\'t been there but I love this concept - (from the I Knit website) "I Knit started life as a small group of friends who met one night at The Beehive pub in Vauxhall, London and who shared a common thread - knitting. Gerard wanted to meet other knitters who didn\'t mind dropping a few stitches over a pint or two, and who wanted to get out and knit instead of sitting in front of the TV at home. Since that first meeting the I Knit London group has met in over 20 different venues across the capital and continues to do so, every two weeks, attracting knitters of all ages and abilities for a social, creative, and sometimes drunken, experience. The knitting group is still the fundamental driving force behind everything we do."

WE ENCOURAGE ALL KNITTERS TO THINK OUTSIDE THE SOX! WE ARE ALSO PART OF THEIR EXCLUSIVE SOCK CLUB, MEANING WE RECEIVE THE LIMITED EDITION TOFUTSIES COLORS!

properties.name: Knit and Stitch = Bliss in Bethesda, MD
properties.description: Posted by Js11284706 Bethesda Ave., Bethesda, MD 20814Knit and Stitch = Bliss is (another) one of my LYS here in the DC area. It\'s located upstairs above a Starbucks, conveniently located very close to the Bethesda Metro station. They have a fairly large space with yarn-filled shelves lining the walls. Good selection, friendly staff. One great thing is that the store keeps a computer database of registered customers\' purchases, which makes it easy to retrieve information if/when needed. For example, when I recently needed to purchase an additional skein of yarn to complete a project, the store was able to pull up a log of my purchase on the computer and set aside for me a skein of yarn from the same dye lot.

properties.description: Posted by Js11282572 Old Philadelphia Pike Lancaster, PA 17505A great yarn/fiber store in Lancaster PA featuring handspun yarns, fibers, roving, etc from local farms/animals and spinners. On some days, you can see some of the proprietor\'s own sheep grazing or the dyeing of roving and/or yarn behind the store. I would travel to Lancaster from the DC area just to visit this store.

Itäkeskus mall is also worth a visit to get a more international flavour, because of the high share of immigrants. The Zara boutique is also less crowded that the one downtown. Itäkeskus/Östra centrum, take the metro. Öppettider/Opening hours: mon-fri 10-18, sat 10-14

properties.name: Oldtowne Needlecrafts
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 9774 Center St Manassas, VAOld Town Needlecrafts is proudly owned and operated by Jannette Jackson. Jannette first became interested in this profession while working for Creative Expressions Needlework in upstate New York doing home parties and teaching and selling kits. When she moved to Manassas she was frustrated at not being able to find the right sized knitting needle for a project she began in NY. She figured she could not be the only person who knits in the area and decided to open a shop specifically to meet knitting needs. This specialty shop grew to other needlecraft types to meet her specific customer’s needs.

properties.name: Spark Craft Studio
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Spark fills many crafty needs, but their knitting stuff is on the lower level. They have a few books and magazines, a limited range of needles, and lovely high-end (expensive) yarns. They have a drop-in crafting membership which I\'ve never tried, but my knitting gang had a really fun time one night hanging out there knitting as a free trial. The renovation of the building is totally beautiful. They sell some local designers\' wares. They have TONS of scrapbooking stuff.

properties.name: Stitch DC - Capitol Hill
properties.description: Posted by Js1128 731 8th St Street SE, Washington, DC 20003This is the first location of Stitch DC here in the capital city. It\'s conveniently located near a Metro stop (Eastern Market Metro Station) in a lovely area of the city - down the street from the Eastern Market flea & farmer\'s market, and across the street from the Marine Corps Barracks. The storefront is charming, with a beautiful window display, and the store itself is filled with a wide variety of yarns. (The other two locations - in Georgetown and Chevy Chase - carry slightly different stock.) There are two rooms separated by a pretty courtyard and connected by a long hallway. I highly recommend making a day of it - the Market is a great deal of fun to browse on a lazy weekend morning or afternoon, with a not-so-quick stop at the LYS!

properties.name: Stitch DC - Chevy Chase in Washington, DC
properties.description: Posted by Js11285520 Connecticut Ave NW Washington, DC 20015Third and most recent location of Stitch DC in the nation\'s capital. The three locations - Capitol Hill, Georgetown, Chevy Chase - all have slightly different selection of yarns, etc.

properties.name: Stitch DC - Georgetown in Washington, DC
properties.description: Posted by Js11281071 Wisconsin Ave NW, Washington, DC 20007Second of three locations in the nation\'s capital. The three locations - Capitol Hill, Georgetown, and Chevy Chase - all carry fantastic but slightly varying selections of yarn, etc.

properties.name: Stitches and Scones
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing120 N Union St Westfield, IN 46074(317) 896-4411 Monday-Friday 10AM-5PM Thursday 10AM-8PM Saturday 9AM-4PM Sunday Closed Stitches and Scones is a unique gathering place located in downtown Westfield, Indiana, in a renovated historic building. We have an experienced and friendly staff to help you with any questions, and we offer beginner, intermediate and advanced classes for knitting, crochet, spinning and weaving. We also do many special orders. Gift cards and a gift registry are available, as well as frequent customer rewards. We support call ahead and drive-up orders and provide a children\'s play area for your shopping convenience. Our store is handicapped accessible.

properties.name: Strick-Sinfonie
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingAnsbacher Strasse 55, Berlin, Germanyinformation via Ravelry Ansbacher Strasse 55 (U Wittenbergplatz) 10777 Berlin Tel. 030 - 56975699 open Mo-Fr 10.30 - 18.30 Sa 12.00 - 16.00 The shop opened in autumn 2006 and offers a variety of not-so-expensive Lana Grossa yarns. There is also a knit meet on tuesdays, ca. 17.00-18.30 Uhr (please call the shop for details, before you join). Not too big and comfortable. Ansbacher Strasse is situated on the left side of the KaDeWe-building, while the Idee/KaDeWe in Passauer Strasse is situated on it’s right side. The friendly shop owner lady originates from France and sometimes buys French yarns when on vacation there. She kept a Bergère-de-France sample catalogue when I visited some days ago. Little chance to see such a thing elsewhere!

properties.name: Woolwinders in Rockville MD
properties.description: Posted by Js1128404 King Farm Boulevard, Rockville, MD 20850Woolwinders is one of my LYS here in the DC area. It\'s a lovely store with a good variety of yarns, needles, books, etc., and an equally lovely staff. In addition to a range of classes, they offer a great series called Sundays in the Salon, which is a free weekly session of special programs, knitalongs, gift ideas & instruction, and charity projects.

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing1051 E 2nd Ave Durango, CO 81301(970) 259-9827 Mon-Sat 10-6 Closed Sunday MOVING IN JUNE We\'re Moving. Our new location is just down the street. We will be moving early June. The new address is 755 E. 2nd Avenue, formerly The Open Shutter Gallery. Visit our Blogs! Knit-A-Long Blog: www.yarndurango.blogspot.com Sock of the Month Blog: www.yarndurangosocks.blogspot.com Fiber Fun Blog: www.durangofiberfun.blogspot.com Yarn shop + tea bar!

properties.name: Yarn Boutique Brighton Commons
properties.description: Posted by Pheasant 1855 Monroe Ave Rochester, NY 14618We stock numerous brands such as Berroco, Plymouth, Lambs Pride, Debbie Bliss, Trendsetter, Tahki/Stacy Charles, Noro, On Line, Karabella, Great Adirondack Yarns, Nature Wools, Mission Falls, Reynolds and many others. We also have a large selection of needles including Addi Turbo and KA. We also have a large and wonderful selection buttons. We are now holding classes for all skill levels.

properties.name: Yarn Forward
properties.description: Posted by Mairi 474 Hazeldean Road, Kanata, ON K2L 4E5Our store hours are: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday - 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Thursday - 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Saturday - 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sunday - Noon to 5 p.m. Every Thursday afternoon we have a Sit \'N Knit. Just come along to the store, bring your current project, sit around our table and chat, swap ideas, and have a good time. We provide the coffee, tea and cookies, and help if you need it. There is no charge, and no purchase is necessary.
